page.title: 10WHAT GOES ON IN CHURCHILL
page.content: Churchill, with the hamlet of Sarsden, is a small combined village, with a few regular events, many of which take place in the village hall. There is usually some village activity each month which draws people together, and fund-raising events for charities are well-supported. There is a weekly keep-fit class, and fortnightly whist drives , as well as an annual gymkhana. There is also a twice-yearly village market in aid of upkeep of the village hall. This summer an afternoon cream tea with stalls was held to raise money for street lighting, and a fete at Sarsden Glebe to raise funds for the church. There are choral and instrumental concerts which take place in the church, and carols are sung around the lighted Christmas tree on the village green.
